StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Gene-Environment, Admixture and Latino Asthmatics (GALAII) Study

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGOUNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
The GALAII Study was funded via NIH R01 ES015794.
All study collaborators: Shannon Thyne, UCSF; Harold J. Farber, Texas Children’s Hospital; Denise Serebrisky, Jacobi Medical Center; Rajesh Kumar, Lurie Children’s Hospital of Chicago; Emerita Brigino-Buenaventura, Kaiser Permante; Michael A. LeNoir, Bay Area Pediatrics; Kelley Meade, Children’s Hospital, Oakland; William Rodriguez-Cintron, VA Hospital, Puerto Rico; Pedro C. Avila, Northwestern University, Jose R. Rodriguez-Santana, Centro de Neumologia Pediatrica.
The authors acknowledge the families and patients for their participation and thank the numerous health care providers and community clinics for their support and participation in GALA II. In particular, the authors thank study coordinator Sandra Salazar; the recruiters who obtained the data: Duanny Alva, MD, Gaby Ayala-Rodriguez, Lisa Caine, Elizabeth Castellanos, Jaime Colon, Denise DeJesus, Blanca Lopez , Brenda Lopez, MD, Louis Martos, Vivian Medina, Juana Olivo, Mario Peralta, Esther Pomares, MD, Jihan Quraishi, Johanna Rodriguez, Shahdad Saeedi, Dean Soto, Ana Taveras.
See publication: PMID: 23750510
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data must be related to Lung Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Data users will be required to obtain IRB approval for their projects from their respective institutions (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted). Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s). Informed consent restrict the use of data analysis related to lung diseases including asthma/allergies (immunologic disease), asthma related traits(e.g., obesity), drug response, genetic ancestry to adjust for differences between cases and controls and to identify new genes related to clinical phenotypes.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Lung Diseases, IRB, COL)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-LD-IRB-COL
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Lung Diseases. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).
Use of the data must be related to Lung Disease. Data users will be required to obtain IRB approval for their projects from their respective institutions. Only full or expedited approvals will be accepted, and this study requires an annual IRB review and approval. Informed consent restrict the use of data analysis related to lung diseases including asthma/allergies (immunologic disease), asthma related traits(e.g., obesity), drug response, genetic ancestry to adjust for differences between cases and controls and to identify new genes related to clinical phenotypes. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Lung Disease, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-LD-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Lung Disease and related disorders.
Use of the data must be related to Lung Disease. Data users will be required to obtain IRB approval for their projects from their respective institutions (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted). Informed consent restrict the use of data analysis related to lung diseases including asthma/allergies (immunologic disease), asthma related traits(e.g., obesity), drug response, genetic ancestry to adjust for differences between cases and controls and to identify new genes related to clinical phenotypes. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).
